name: 李旻璁
objective:
This course introduces the fundamentals of computer programming. Students will learn the basic components of computer language through exercises during class time. 

The goals of this course is to help students feel confident of their ability to map scientific problems into computational framework, design mathematical algorithms, write and debug programs for specific tasks. We will use gfortran compiler to learn Fortran – the language which has a long relation with scientific computing in Chemical Engineering. 

Students are welcome, but not required, to bring their own computers to the class. GFortran is a free compiler on major platforms, you can install it on Windows with Cygwin, on Mac with homebrew, and on any distro of Linux.
schedule:
week 01. class intro, working environment, program, compiler, gnuplot, etc.
week 02. structure, input and output, declaration, format
week 03. loop (do) and decision (if)
week 04. math operators and functions
week 05. array and files
week 06. subroutine and module
week 07. sorting
week 08. Newton’s method
week 09. random number generator
week 10-17. special topic
week 18. final exam
scorePolicy:
# English – Except for the 1st class, everyone need to use English for any kind of communication.
# Problem-based learning – The class is student-centered. Everyone need to come to class on time and participate the class discussions.  
# Grading – Class participation (+60), class exercises (+20), final exam (+20) 
# Networking – everyone should prepare their NTUT Google account. Everything you have done will be documented in the shared Google Drive folders.
